ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING REVIEW

(Please refer to guidance at the end of this document)

fields.name: txt21

Comments

(Yes or No and additional explanations)

fields.name: txt22
fields.fieldText: Money Laundering Risk Assessment - Not Personal Tax

fields.name: txt23
fields.fieldText: Is the business structure complex/unusual?

fields.name: txt24
fields.fieldText: Does the client transact with businesses in overseas countries with weak money laundering regimes?

fields.name: txt25
fields.fieldText: Is control remote?

fields.name: text25
fields.fieldText: Is it a cash business?

fields.name: txt28
fields.fieldText:
Do we have any concerns over the source of the client’s funds?


﻿A “Yes” answer to ANY of the above means the client must be treated as high risk

fields.name: txt27
fields.fieldText: Have we met the client face to face?

fields.name: Name1
fields.fieldText: Name

fields.name: txt29
fields.fieldText:
If “No” the client must be treated as high risk


Has the client or a member of their family or a known close associate become a Politically Exposed Person (PEP)?

fields.name: txt30
fields.fieldText:
If “Yes” the client must be treated as high risk and Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) procedures as set out in the firm’s Client Acceptance Guidance Notes (available on the intranet) applied. Record EDD procedures undertaken here:


Considering the above factors, the Money Laundering Risk is:

fields.name: txt31
fields.fieldText: Has the risk level changed from Normal to High since the previously recorded risk level?

fields.name: txt32
fields.fieldText:
If “Yes” details of the additional verification work carried out:

 

NB: Identity verification

 

Normal Risk:  SmartSearch check (“Normal” risk setting) OR one government issued document with photo e.g. passport or driving licence;

 

High Risk:      SmartSearch check (“High” risk setting) OR one government issued document with photo e.g. passport or driving licence AND document detailing address e.g. utility bill.

fields.name: txt33
fields.fieldText:
Ensure that the “know your client” information held on our files for anti-money laundering purposes is updated for any changes identified above and in any other relevant respects. Ensure any changes to Beneficial Ownership are recorded and any additional ID verification undertaken.

 

Record the Current Beneficial Owners and the basis of beneficial ownership below:

Ø ??

Ø ??

Ø ??

fields.name: txt34
fields.fieldText:
For Non-Audit services added to an Audit client please complete the questions below


1. The type of non-audit service giving as much detail as possible, including the fee level? 

2. The services are to be carried out by a separate team with a separate partner not involved in the audit which are?

3. Any other safeguards that are deemed necessary by the Audit partner?

4. Full details of the ethical considerations should be detailed on the Audit file by the Audit partner (this must be confirmed on the CF)?

fields.name: txt35
fields.fieldText: Considering the answers to the above should we still be acting for the client?

fields.name: headerTxt1
fields.fieldText: ﻿ENGAGEMENT CONTINUATION & ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHECKLIST

fields.name: clientNameTxt
fields.fieldText: CLIENT: {!Get_Case.Contact.FirstName} {!Get_Case.Contact.LastName}

fields.name: DATE
fields.fieldText: DATE

fields.name: txt1
fields.fieldText:
GENERAL CONTINUATION PROCEDURES

(Please refer to guidance at the end of this document)

fields.name: txt2
fields.fieldText:
Comments

(Yes or No and additional explanations)

fields.name: txt3
fields.fieldText: Please use this checklist annually for AML purposes and when determining whether to continue with an engagement:

fields.name: txt4
fields.fieldText:
Consider changes that may alter the original assessment of the acceptability of the client and engagement.

 

Examples of changes that shall cause a careful reconsideration are:

·     Changes in name and/or address;

·       a significant change in the size, structure or nature of the client's business;

·     new sources of finance;

·     a major change in the ownership, management or Trustees of the client;

·     new regulatory reporting requirements: and/or

·     additional service added.

fields.name: txt5
fields.fieldText:
Conflict checking shall require determining whether there were any:

 

·     changes in the controlling ownership interests over the entity;

·     changes in any controlling interests held by the entity;

·     new listings in the group;

·     any known change in service providers that may impact independence; or

·     changes in classification of the entity as public interest.

 

Any such changes will require reconsideration of the firm’s conflict checking procedures.

fields.name: headerTxt4
fields.fieldText: ﻿ENGAGEMENT CONTINUATION & ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHECKLIST

fields.name: guidanceTxt
fields.fieldText:
Guidance


1. Cooper Parry procedures require that all client relationships be periodically reviewed to determine whether continuation of the relationship is appropriate. Cooper Parry require this review to be carried out at least annually.


2. Examples of matters which should be considered when making continuation decisions are set out in section a of this checklist. This is not an exhaustive list and there may be other matters which are relevant to the continuation decision.


3. The Money Laundering Regulations 2017 require periodic reassessment of the level of money laundering risk attaching to each client. Please answer the questions in section c (for Personal Tax clients) or d (for all other clients) to assess the level of risk as either High or Normal. The risk level should then be entered into the client’s Dynamics record in the “Money Laundering Risk Level” field which will be found on the onboarding tab (the Risk Team will add this)


4. The Money Laundering Regulations also require periodic review and updating of our “know your client” information. The processes detailed in points 1 to 5 above should largely result in this requirement being met but we should consider whether there are any other matters where we need to obtain information or confirmation. In particular, if the assessed level of money laundering risk has changed then we need to satisfy ourselves that the client due diligence information which we hold is adequate.


5. This completed checklist and all other documentation supporting the carrying out of the procedures set out herein should be saved against the client on Dynamics.


6. Please contact Michelle McDonald if you have any queries.
